sources.title: The Heroes of Telemark (1965) Spies sabotage the secret weaponâ€”one explosive mission!
sources.description:
Norwegian resistance works to sabotage a German-controlled heavy water plant, crucial for developing atomic bombs during World War II.

Original title: The Heroes of Telemark
Alternative title: The Unknown Battle

Director: Anthony Mann
Writers: Ben Barzman, Ivan Moffat

Main cast:
Kirk Douglas - Dr. Rolf Pedersen
Richard Harris - Knut Straud
Ulla Jacobsson - Anna Pedersen
Michael Redgrave - Uncle
Eric Porter - Major Frick

Genres: Action, War, Drama, History
Release date: November 23, 1965 (London Premiere)
Filming location: Norway


00:00 - Full movie with subtitles
04:20 - Dr. Rolf Pedersen is recruited by Knut Straud to join the Norwegian resistance against the WWII regime nuclear program.
15:42 - Pedersen and Straud infiltrate a German-controlled factory to gather intelligence on heavy water production.
32:10 - The resistance team devises a daring plan to sabotage the plant, risking their lives for the mission.
48:25 - Pedersen and Straud lead a perilous raid, planting explosives to destroy the heavy water facility.
1:05:37 - The n@zis retaliate, forcing the resistance to flee across treacherous snow-covered terrain.
1:22:50 - Pedersen faces a moral dilemma as the team debates sacrificing civilians to stop the weapon.
1:40:15 - The resistance executes a final, high-stakes operation to sink a ferry carrying heavy water.
2:03:45 - Pedersen reflects on the cost of their victory as the mission's success ensures the Germans' defeat.

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=UUMOycDFnpMeWzaITQSD1dWsOA

@CultCinemaClassics

metadata.Plot: Set in German-occupied Norway, this is an embellished account of the remarkable efforts of the Norwegian resistance to sabotage the German development of the atomic bomb. Resistance fighter Knut Straud (Richard Harris) enlists the reluctant physicist Dr. Rolf Pedersen (Kirk Douglas) in an effort to destroy the German heavy water production plant near the village of Rjukan in rural Telemark. In the process, Pedersen discovers that his ex-wife Anna (Ulla Jacobsson) and her uncle (Sir Michael Redgrave) have also joined the resistance. British commandos dispatched to destroy the plant are killed when their glider hits the mountainside at night. An improvised raid by the resistance ends in the partial destruction of the heavy water canisters, but the contingency plans of Reichskommissar Terboven (Eric Porter) enable the Germans to resume production quickly. Pedersen wants to recommend to London that the Allies bomb the plant. Straud opposes him because of the potential death toll on Norwegian civilians and a fight ensues. They send in separate recommendations, and the air raid takes place, but it fails to destroy the heavy water. A Norwegian traitor gives away the resistance hideout, and Anna's uncle is killed. The Germans load the canisters onto a ferry for shipment to Germany, and the resistance rig explosives to sink the ferry in the fjord. As the ferry is about to leave, it is boarded by the widow and baby of one of Pedersen's and Straud's colleagues. Pedersen boards the ferry and organizes a children's game of "lifejacket" in order to minimize civilian deaths. This movie closes with resistance members rescuing passengers as the ferry sinks.
metadata.Writer: Ivan Moffat, Ben Barzman, Harold Pinter
metadata.Actors: Kirk Douglas, Richard Harris, Ulla Jacobsson
